metadata.title: USN-6841-1 -- PHP vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that PHP could early return in the filter_var function resulting in invalid user information being treated as valid user information. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose raw user input information.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6841-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-cgi - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-cli - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-common - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-curl - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-dba - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-dev - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-enchant - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-fpm - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-gd - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-gmp - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-imap - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-interbase - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-intl - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-ldap - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-mbstring - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-mysql - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-odbc - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-opcache - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-pgsql - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-phpdbg - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-pspell - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-readline - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-snmp - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-soap - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-sqlite3 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-sybase - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-tidy - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-xml - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-xsl - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 php8.1-zip - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.18 No subscription required
